summary.span: 提供有关日期和时间值格式的区域性特定信息。

span.span: Provides culture-specific information about the format of date and time values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 属性类包含格式化或解析如下所示的日期和时间值的特定于区域性的信息：The properties of the class contain culture-specific information for formatting or parsing date and time values such as the following: - 用于设置日期值的格式的模式。The patterns used to format date values. - 用于设置时间值的格式的模式。The patterns used to format time values. - 一周中的天的名称。The names of the days of the week. - 一年中的月份的名称。The names of the months of the year. - 上午The A.M. 和下午and P.M. 时间值中使用的指示符。designators used in time values. - 日历日期表示。The calendar in which dates are expressed. 本节内容：In this section: - [实例化 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object](#instantiating) - [用于固定区域性For the Invariant Culture](#instantiating_Invariant) - [针对特定区域性For a Specific Culture](#instantiating_Specific) - [对于非特定区域性For a neutral culture](#instantiating_neutral) - [为当前区域性For the current culture](#instantiating_Current) - [DateTimeFormatInfo 和动态数据DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) - [格式设置日期和时间Formatting dates and times](#Formatting_dates_times) - [格式字符串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 属性Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#format-strings-and-datetimeformatinfo-properties) - [修改 DateTimeFormatInfo 属性Modifying DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#Modifying) ## 实例化 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object 一个对象可以表示固定区域性、 特定区域性、 一个非特定区域性或当前区域性的格式设置约定。A object can represent the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, a specific culture, a neutral culture, or the current culture. 本部分讨论了如何实例化每种类型的对象。This section discusses how to instantiate each type of object. ### 实例化用于固定区域性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for the invariant culture 固定的区域性表示是不区分区域性的区域性。The invariant culture represents a culture that is culture-insensitive. 它基于英语的语言，但不是在任何特定说英语的国家/地区。It is based on the English language, but not on any specific English-speaking country/region. 尽管特定区域性的数据可以是动态和可以更改以反映新的区域性约定或用户首选项，固定区域性的数据不会更改。Although the data of specific cultures can be dynamic and can change to reflect new cultural conventions or user preferences, the data of the invariant culture does not change. 可以实例化对象，表示固定区域性的格式设置约定按以下方式：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the invariant culture in the following ways: - 通过检索的值属性。By retrieving the value of the property. 返回对象是只读的。The returned object is read-only. - 通过调用无参数构造函数。By calling the parameterless constructor. 返回对象是读/写。The returned object is read/write. - 通过检索的值属性从返回的对象属性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 返回对象是只读的。The returned object is read-only. 下面的示例使用两种方法来实例化表示固定区域性的对象。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the invariant culture. 然后，它指示该对象是只读的。It then indicates whether the object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#1)] ### 实例化特定区域性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for a specific culture 特定区域性表示特定国家/地区中讲述的语言。A specific culture represents a language that is spoken in a particular country/region. 例如，EN-US 表示美国，所使用的英语语言的特定区域性，en CA 是表示在加拿大所使用的英语语言的特定区域性。For example, en-US is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in the United States, and en-CA is a specific culture that represents the English language spoken in Canada. 可以实例化对象，表示特定区域性的格式设置约定按以下方式：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture in the following ways: - 通过调用方法，并检索所返回的值对象的属性。By calling the method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 返回对象是只读的。The returned object is read-only. - 通过传递静态方法对象，表示区域性的对象想要检索。By passing the static method a object that represents the culture whose object you want to retrieve. 返回对象是读/写。The returned object is read/write. - 通过调用静态方法，并检索所返回的值对象的属性。By calling the static method and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 返回对象是读/写。The returned object is read/write. - 通过调用类构造函数，并检索所返回的值对象的属性。By calling the class constructor and retrieving the value of the returned object's property. 返回对象是读/写。The returned object is read/write. 下面的示例说明了每种方法来实例化对象，并指示生成的对象是只读的。The following example illustrates each of these ways to instantiate a object and indicates whether the resulting object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#3)] ### 实例化一个非特定区域性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for a neutral culture 非特定区域性表示区域性或语言无关的国家/地区;它通常是一个或多个特定区域性的父级。A neutral culture represents a culture or language that is independent of a country/region; it is typically the parent of one or more specific cultures. 例如，Fr 是非特定区域性的法语语言和 FR-FR 区域性的父级。For example, Fr is a neutral culture for the French language and the parent of the fr-FR culture. 可以实例化对象，在您创建的相同方式表示非特定区域性的格式设置约定对象，表示特定区域性的格式设置约定。You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of a neutral culture in the same ways that you create a object that represents the formatting conventions of a specific culture. 此外，可以检索非特定区域性通过从特定区域性的检索非特定区域性的对象属性并检索返回的对象其属性。In addition, you can retrieve a neutral culture's object by retrieving a neutral culture from a specific culture's property and retrieving the object returned by its property. 除非父区域性表示固定区域性，返回的对象是读/写。Unless the parent culture represents the invariant culture, the returned object is read/write. 下面的示例阐释了实例化的方法表示非特定区域性的对象。The following example illustrates these ways of instantiating a object that represents a neutral culture. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create1.vb#2)] > [!NOTE] > 在通过.NET Framework 版本 1.0 中[!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)]，尝试检索反映了一个非特定区域性的格式设置约定的对象将引发异常。In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 through [!INCLUDE[net_v35_short](~/includes/net-v35-short-md.md)], trying to retrieve a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a neutral culture throws a exception. 但是，非特定区域性缺少区域性特定格式设置信息，因为它是独立于特定的国家/地区。However, a neutral culture lacks culture-specific formatting information, because it is independent of a specific country/region. 而不是填充.NET Framework 返回泛型值对象反映了特定的格式设置约定的区域性的对象是非特定区域性的子级。Instead of populating the object with generic values, the .NET Framework returns a object that reflects the formatting conventions of a specific culture that is a child of the neutral culture. 例如，对象的非特定 en 区域性反映 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定和对象的 fr 区域性反映 FR-FR 区域性的格式设置约定。For example, the object for the neutral en culture reflects the formatting conventions of the en-US culture, and the object for the fr culture reflects the formatting conventions of the fr-FR culture. 可以使用如下所示的代码来确定哪些特定区域性的格式设置约定表示非特定区域性。You can use code like the following to determine which specific culture's formatting conventions a neutral culture represents. 该示例使用反射来比较的非特定区域性使用的特定子区域性属性的属性。The example uses reflection to compare the properties of a neutral culture with the properties of a specific child culture. 它会考虑两个日历为如果它们是相同的日历类型等效，并且对于公历日历，则其属性具有相同的值。It considers two calendars to be equivalent if they are the same calendar type and, for Gregorian calendars, if their properties have identical values. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate6c.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate6c.vb#6)] ### 实例化的当前区域性的 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object for the current culture 可以实例化对象，表示当前区域性的格式设置约定按以下方式：You can instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture in the following ways: - 通过检索的值属性。By retrieving the value of the property. 返回对象是只读的。The returned object is read-only. - 通过检索的值属性从返回的对象属性。By retrieving the value of the property from the object that is returned by the property. 返回对象是只读的。The returned object is read-only. - 通过调用方法替换对象，表示当前区域性。By calling the method with a object that represents the current culture. 返回对象是只读的。The returned object is read-only. 下面的示例使用两种方法来实例化对象，表示当前区域性的格式设置约定。The following example uses each of these methods to instantiate a object that represents the formatting conventions of the current culture. 然后，它指示该对象是只读的。It then indicates whether the object is read-only. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/create2.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/create2.vb#4)] 您可以创建可写对象，表示以下一种方式中的当前线程区域性的约定：You can create a writable object that represents the conventions of the current thread culture in one of these ways: - 通过检索对象中的任何三个以前的方法和调用对返回对象。By retrieving a object in any of the three previous ways and calling the method on the returned object. 这将创建一份原始对象，不同之处在于其属性是`false`。This creates a copy of the original object, except that its property is `false`. - 通过调用方法来创建对象，表示当前区域性，然后使用其属性来检索对象。By calling the method to create a object that represents the current culture, and then using its property to retrieve the object. 下面的示例演示实例化一个读/写的每一种方式对象，并显示的值及其属性。The following example illustrates each way of instantiating a read/write object and displays the value of its property. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate2.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate2.vb#7)] 在 Windows 中，用户可以覆盖其中某些格式设置和分析通过操作中使用的属性值**地区和语言**控制面板中的应用程序。In Windows, the user can override some of the property values used in formatting and parsing operations through the **Region and Language** application in Control Panel. 例如，其区域性为英语 （美国） 的用户可能选择而不是默认 12 小时时钟 （在格式 h:mm: ss tt) 显示长时间 （采用格式： 分： 秒） 使用 24 小时制的时间值。For example, a user whose culture is English (United States) might choose to display long time values using a 24-hour clock (in the format HH:mm:ss) instead of the default 12-hour clock (in the format h:mm:ss tt). 中所述的方法检索的对象以前所有反映这些用户重写。The objects retrieved in the ways discussed previously all reflect these user overrides. 如果这是不可取，则可以创建不会反映用户的对象重写 （和也是读/写而不是只读的） 通过调用构造函数，并提供的值`false`为`useUserOverride`参数。If this is undesirable, you can create a object that does not reflect user overrides (and is also read/write instead of read-only) by calling the constructor and supplying a value of `false` for the `useUserOverride` argument. 下面的示例阐释了这一点对于系统当前区域性为英语 （美国） 和其长时间模式已从默认值为 h:mm: ss tt 更改为 hh: mm:。The following example illustrates this for a system whose current culture is English (United States) and whose long time pattern has been changed from the default of h:mm:ss tt to HH:mm:ss. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/instantiate3.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/instantiate3.vb#8)] ## DateTimeFormatInfo 和动态数据DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data 用于提供的日期和时间值的格式的特定于区域性的数据类是动态的就像通过提供的区域性数据一样类。The culture-specific data for formatting date and time values provided by the class is dynamic, just like cultural data provided by the class. 不应造成稳定性的值的任何假设关联的对象与特定对象。You should not make any assumptions about the stability of values for objects that are associated with particular objects. 仅提供固定区域性和其关联的数据是稳定的对象。Only the data provided by the invariant culture and its associated object is stable. 应用程序会话之间或甚至运行你的应用程序时，可以更改其他数据。Other data can change between application sessions or even while your application is running. 有四个主要源的更改：There are four major sources of change: - 系统更新。System updates. 随着时间的推移更改首选的日历或惯用的日期和时间格式等区域首选项。Cultural preferences such as the preferred calendar or customary date and time formats change over time. 在此情况下，Windows 更新包括对更改特定区域性的属性值。When this happens, Windows Update includes changes to the property value for a particular culture. - 替换区域性。Replacement cultures. 类可用于替换现有的区域性的数据。The class can be used to replace the data of an existing culture. - 对属性值的级联更改。Cascading changes to property values. 多个区域性相关的属性可以更改在运行时，这又会导致要更改的数据。A number of culture-related properties can change at run time, which, in turn, causes data to change. 例如，可以更改当前区域性，以编程方式或通过用户操作。For example, the current culture can be changed either programmatically or through user action. 在此情况下，返回对象属性更改为与当前区域性关联的对象。When this happens, the object returned by the property changes to an object associated with the current culture. 同样，区域性的日历可以更改，这可能会导致在更改为大量属性值。Similarly, a culture's calendar can change, which can result in changes to numerous property values. - 用户首选项。User preferences. 应用程序的用户可以选择重写一些与通过控制面板中的区域和语言选项的当前系统区域性关联的值。Users of your application might choose to override some of the values associated with the current system culture through the regional and language options in Control Panel. 例如，用户可能选择不同的格式显示日期。For example, users might choose to display the date in a different format. 如果属性设置为`true`的属性从用户设置还检索对象。If the property is set to `true`, the properties of the object is also retrieved from the user settings. 如果用户设置与不兼容与关联的区域性对象 (例如，如果在所选的日历不是所指示的日历之一属性)，这些方法和属性的值的结果未定义。If the user settings are incompatible with the culture associated with the object (for example, if the selected calendar is not one of the calendars indicated by the property), the results of the methods and the values of the properties are undefined. 若要尽可能一致的数据的所有用户可重写属性对象创建对象时进行初始化。To minimize the possibility of inconsistent data, all user-overridable properties of a object are initialized when the object is created. 则仍可能的不一致，因为创建对象和用户重写过程都不是原子和相关的值可以在对象创建期间发生更改。There is still a possibility of inconsistency, because neither object creation nor the user override process is atomic and the relevant values can change during object creation. 但是，这种情况下应该极少。However, this situation should be extremely rare. 您可以控制用户重写会反映在对象表示与系统区域性相同的区域性。You can control whether user overrides are reflected in objects that represent the same culture as the system culture. 下表列出了在其中的方式对象可以检索，指示生成的对象是否反映用户重写。The following table lists the ways in which a object can be retrieved and indicates whether the resulting object reflects user overrides. |CultureInfo 和 DateTimeFormatInfo 对象数据源Source of CultureInfo and DateTimeFormatInfo object|反映用户替代Reflects user overrides| |---------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------| |`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat` 属性`CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat` property|是Yes| | 属性 property|是Yes| | 方法 method|是Yes| | 方法 method|NoNo| | 构造函数 constructor|是Yes| | 构造函数 constructor|取决于值`useUserOverride`参数Depends on value of `useUserOverride` parameter| 除非有其他人信服的理由，否则当你使用时应遵守用户重写进行格式化和分析用户输入或显示数据的客户端应用程序中的对象。Unless there is a compelling reason to do otherwise, you should respect user overrides when you use the object in client applications to format and parse user input or to display data. 对于服务器应用程序或无人参与的应用程序，您不应。For server applications or unattended applications, you should not. 但是，如果使用的对象是显式或隐式要持久保存以字符串形式的日期和时间数据，您都应使用应该指定反映固定区域性，或者您的格式设置约定的对象自定义日期和时间格式的使用而不考虑区域性的字符串。However, if you are using the object either explicitly or implicitly to persist date and time data in string form, you should either use a object that reflects the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, or you should specify a custom date and time format string that you use regardless of culture. ## 格式设置日期和时间Formatting dates and times 一个对象在所有日期和时间格式设置操作中使用隐式或显式。A object is used implicitly or explicitly in all date and time formatting operations. 其中包括对以下方法的调用：These include calls to the following methods: - 所有日期和时间格式设置方法，如和。All date and time formatting methods, such as and . - 主要的复合格式设置方法，即。The major composite formatting method, which is . - 格式设置方法，如其他复合和。Other composite formatting methods, such as and . 所有日期和时间格式设置操作进行都使用的实现。All date and time formatting operations make use of an implementation. 接口包含一个方法， 。The interface includes a single method, . 此回调方法传递表示提供格式设置信息所需的类型的对象。This callback method is passed a object that represents the type needed to provide formatting information. 该方法返回该类型的实例或`null`如果它不能提供的类型的实例。The method returns either an instance of that type or `null` if it cannot provide an instance of the type. .NET Framework 包括两个格式化日期和时间的实现：The .NET Framework includes two implementations for formatting dates and times: - 类，该类表示特定区域性 （或特定国家/地区中的特定语言）。The class, which represents a specific culture (or a specific language in a specific country/region). 在日期和时间格式设置操作中，方法将返回与关联的对象及其属性。In a date and time formatting operation, the method returns the object associated with its property. - 类，该类提供的格式设置约定及其关联的区域性的信息。The class, which provides information about the formatting conventions of its associated culture. 方法返回自身的实例。The method returns an instance of itself. 如果实现未提供格式设置方法显式对象返回的使用表示当前线程区域性的属性。If an implementation is not provided to a formatting method explicitly, the object returned by the property that represents the current thread culture is used. 下面的示例说明之间的关系接口和在格式设置操作的类。The following example illustrates the relationship between the interface and the class in formatting operations. 定义一个自定义实现其方法显示请求的格式设置操作的对象的类型。It defines a custom implementation whose method displays the type of the object requested by the formatting operation. 如果它请求对象，该方法提供了当前线程区域性的对象。If it is requesting a object, the method provides the object for the current thread culture. 如示例所示，输出方法请求对象提供格式设置信息，而方法请求并对象以及实现。As the output from the example shows, the method requests a object to provide formatting information, whereas the method requests and objects as well as an implementation. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/formatprovider1.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/formatprovider1.vb#9)] ## 格式字符串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 属性Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties 对象在格式设置日期和时间值的操作包括三种类型的属性的使用：The object includes three kinds of properties that are used in formatting operations with date and time values: - 日历相关的属性。Calendar-related properties. 属性，如， ， ，和，与所使用的日历由区域性，由定义相关联属性。Properties such as , , , and , are associated with the calendar used by the culture, which is defined by the property. 这些属性用于长日期和时间格式。These properties are used for long date and time formats. - 生成标准定义结果字符串的属性。Properties that produce a standards-defined result string. ， ，和属性包含生成结果字符串由国际标准定义的自定义格式字符串。The , , and properties contain custom format strings that produce result strings defined by international standards. 这些属性是只读的不能修改。These properties are read-only and cannot be modified. - 这些属性用于定义区分区域性的结果字符串。Properties that define culture-sensitive result strings. 某些属性，如并，包含[自定义格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)，用于指定结果字符串的格式。Some properties, such as and , contain [custom format strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md) that specify the format of the result string. 其他人，例如， ， ，和，定义区分区域性的符号或可以包含在结果字符串的子字符串。Others, such as , , , and , define culture-sensitive symbols or substrings that can be included in a result string. [标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)，例如"d"、"D"、"f"和"F"，是对应于特定的别名格式模式属性。The [standard date and time format (请参阅[DateTimeFormatInfo 对象进行实例化](#instantiating)部分。)(See the [Instantiating a DateTimeFormatInfo object](#instantiating) section.) 2. 修改属性或用于生成所需的结果字符串的属性。Modify the property or properties that are used to produce the desired result string. (有关如何格式设置方法使用属性以定义结果字符串，请参阅上一节[格式字符串和 DateTimeFormatInfo 属性](#format-strings-and-datetimeformatinfo-properties)。)(For information about how formatting methods use properties to define result strings, see the previous section, [Format strings and DateTimeFormatInfo properties](#format-strings-and-datetimeformatinfo-properties).) 3. 使用自定义对象创建为对格式设置方法的调用中的参数。Use the custom object you created as the argument in calls to formatting methods. 有两种方法可更改的结果字符串的格式：There are two other ways to change the format of a result string: - 可以使用类来定义自定义区域性 （的区域性具有唯一的名称，并补充了现有的区域性） 或一个替换区域性 （一个使用而不是特定区域性）。You can use the class to define either a custom culture (a culture that has a unique name and that supplements existing cultures) or a replacement culture (one that is used instead of a specific culture). 可以保存并以编程方式访问此区域性，就像任何.NET Framework 支持的对象。You can save and access this culture programmatically as you would any object supported by the .NET Framework. - 如果结果字符串不区分区域性的并且不遵循预定义的格式，可以使用自定义日期和时间格式字符串。If the result string is not culture-sensitive and doesn't follow a predefined format, you can use a custom date and time format string. 例如，如果要序列化格式为 YYYYMMDDHHmmss 的日期和时间数据，您可以生成结果字符串将传递到自定义格式字符串方法，并且你可以将结果字符串转换回值通过调用方法。For example, if you are serializing date and time data in the format YYYYMMDDHHmmss, you can generate the result string by passing the custom format string to the method, and you can convert the result string back to a value by calling the method. ### 更改短日期模式Changing the short date pattern 下面的示例更改"d"（短日期） 标准格式字符串生成的结果字符串的格式。The following example changes the format of a result string produced by the "d" (short date) standard format string. 更改关联EN-US 或英语 （美国） 区域性从其默认值为"年-月-日"到属性"yyyy-"MM"-"dd"，并使用"d"标准格式字符串来显示日期之前和之后属性更改。It changes the associated property for the en-US or English (United States) culture from its default of "M/d/yyyy" to "yyyy'-"MM"-"dd" and uses the "d" standard format string to display the date both before and after the property is changed. a literal string is necessary, because the era name is typically returned by the method from private data in the culture tables supplied by either the .NET Framework or the Windows operating system. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/example4.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/example4.vb#11)] ## 分析日期和时间字符串Parsing date and time strings 分析涉及转换的日期和时间的字符串表示形式或值。Parsing involves converting the string representation of a date and time to a or value. 这两种类型包括`Parse`， `TryParse`， `ParseExact`，和`TryParseExact`方法，以支持分析操作。Both of these types include the `Parse`, `TryParse`, `ParseExact`, and `TryParseExact` methods to support parsing operations. `Parse`并`TryParse`方法将转换可以具有多种格式的字符串，而`ParseExact`和`TryParseExact`要求字符串具有定义的格式。The `Parse` and `TryParse` methods convert a string that can have a variety of formats, whereas `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` require that the string have a defined format or formats. 如果在分析操作失败，`Parse`并`ParseExact`引发异常，而`TryParse`并`TryParseExact`返回`false`。If the parsing operation fails, `Parse` and `ParseExact` throw an exception, whereas `TryParse` and `TryParseExact` return `false`. 分析方法隐式或显式使用可出现在字符串进行分析，以及如何解释已分析的字符串或任何缺少枚举值来确定的样式元素 （如前导、 尾随，或内部的空白区域）元素。The parsing methods implicitly or explicitly use a enumeration value to determine which style elements (such as leading, trailing, or inner white space) can be present in the string to be parsed, and how to interpret the parsed string or any missing elements. 如果未提供值在调用时`Parse`或`TryParse`方法中，默认值是，这是包含的复合样式， ，和标志。If you don't provide a value when you call the `Parse` or `TryParse` method, the default is , which is a composite style that includes the , , and flags. 有关`ParseExact`并`TryParseExact`方法，默认值是; 输入的字符串必须精确对应特定自定义日期和时间格式字符串。For the `ParseExact` and `TryParseExact` methods, the default is ; the input string must correspond precisely to a particular custom date and time format string. 分析方法还将隐式或显式使用对象，用于定义特定符号和模式，可在要分析的字符串中出现。The parsing methods also implicitly or explicitly use a object that defines the specific symbols and patterns that can occur in the string to be parsed. 如果未提供对象，对象默认情况下使用当前线程区域性。If you don't provide a object, the object for the current thread culture is used by default. 有关分析日期和时间字符串的详细信息，请参阅单独的分析方法，如， ， ，和。For more information about parsing date and time strings, see the individual parsing methods, such as , , , and . 下面的示例说明了分析日期和时间字符串的区分区域性的性质。The following example illustrates the culture-sensitive nature of parsing date and time strings. 它会尝试通过使用 EN-US、 EN-GB、 FR-FR 和 FI-FI 区域性的约定来分析两个日期字符串。It tries to parse two date strings by using the conventions of the en-US, en-GB, fr-FR, and fi-FI cultures. 将被解释为 8/18/2014 在 EN-US 中的日期的区域性，则会引发中其他三个异常区域性因为 18 解释为月份号。The date that is interpreted as 8/18/2014 in the en-US culture throws a exception in the other three cultures because 18 is interpreted as the month number. 2015 年 1 月 2 日被解析为 EN-US 区域性中的第一个月的第二天，但剩余区域性中的第二个月的第一天。1/2/2015 is parsed as the second day of the first month in the en-US culture, but as the first day of the second month in the remaining cultures. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/parsing1.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/parsing1.vb#15)] 通常有两个原因分析日期和时间的字符串：Date and time strings are typically parsed for two reasons: - 若要将用户输入转换为日期和时间值。To convert user input into a date and time value. - 往返日期和时间值;也就是说，要反序列化之前序列化为字符串的日期和时间值。To round-trip a date and time value; that is, to deserialize a date and time value that was previously serialized as a string. 以下各节讨论中更详细地介绍这两个操作。The following sections discuss these two operations in greater detail. ### 分析用户字符串Parsing user strings 当分析用户输入的日期和时间字符串时，始终应实例化反映用户的区域性设置，包括用户可能已做的任何自定义的对象。When you parse date and time strings input by the user, you should always instantiate a object that reflects the user's cultural settings, including any customizations the user may have made. 否则，日期和时间对象可能不正确的值。Otherwise, the date and time object may have incorrect values. 有关如何实例化对象，用于反映用户区域性的自定义设置，请参阅[DateTimeFormatInfo 和动态数据](#dynamic)部分。For information about how to instantiate a object that reflects user cultural customizations, see the [DateTimeFormatInfo and dynamic data](#dynamic) section. 下面的示例演示的分析操作中反映了用户的区域性设置和一个不之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between a parsing operation that reflects user cultural settings and one that does not. 在这种情况下，默认系统区域性为 EN-US，但用户使用控制面板中，**区域和语言**从其默认值为"年-月-日"的短日期模式更改为"yy/MM/dd"。In this case, the default system culture is en-US, but the user has used Control Panel, **Region and Language** to change the short date pattern from its default of "M/d/yyyy" to "yy/MM/dd". 当用户输入的字符串，用于反映用户设置，并通过分析的字符串对象，它也反映了用户设置 （覆盖），在分析操作返回正确结果。When the user enters a string that reflects user settings, and the string is parsed by a object that also reflects user settings (overrides), the parsing operation returns a correct result. 但是，将字符串分析通过对象，它反映了标准的 EN-US 区域性设置、 分析方法会引发异常，由于它会解释 14 的月数不一年中的最后两位数字。However, when the string is parsed by a object that reflects standard en-US cultural settings, the parsing method throws a exception because it interprets 14 as the number of the month, not the last two digits of the year. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/parse2.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/parse2.vb#16)] ### 序列化和反序列化日期和时间数据Serializing and deserializing date and time data 序列化日期和时间数据应保存/还原;也就是说，所有序列化和反序列化的值应完全相同。Serialized date and time data are expected to round-trip; that is, all serialized and deserialized values should be identical. 如果日期和时间值表示单个时刻，反序列化的值应表示同一时刻而不考虑的区域性或其还原的系统的时区的时间。If a date and time value represents a single moment in time, the deserialized value should represent the same moment in time regardless of the culture or time zone of the system on which it was restored. 往返日期和时间数据已成功，你必须使用返回的固定区域性的约定属性，以生成和分析数据。To round-trip date and time data successfully, you must use the conventions of the invariant culture, which is returned by the property, to generate and parse the data. 格式设置和分析操作应永远不会反映默认区域性的约定。The formatting and parsing operations should never reflect the conventions of the default culture. 如果使用默认的区域性设置，数据的可移植性是严格限制;它可以是线程的仅在线程的区域性特定的设置是线程的相同的依据其进行序列化上成功反序列化。If you use default cultural settings, the portability of the data is strictly limited; it can be successfully deserialized only on a thread whose cultural-specific settings are identical to those of the thread on which it was serialized. 在某些情况下，这意味着，数据不能更成功序列化和反序列化的同一系统上。In some cases, this means that the data cannot even be successfully serialized and deserialized on the same system. 如果日期和时间值的时间部分非常重要，应也转换为 UTC 并使用"o"或"r"序列化[标准格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。If the time component of a date and time value is significant, it should also be converted to UTC and serialized by using the "o" or "r" [standard format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 然后可以通过调用分析方法并将其传递相应的格式字符串使用固定区域性为还原时间数据`provider`参数。The time data can then be restored by calling a parsing method and passing it the appropriate format string along with the invariant culture as the `provider` argument. 下面的示例说明了往返日期和时间值的过程。The following example illustrates the process of round-tripping a date and time value. 其序列化的日期和时间观察到美国的系统上太平洋时间和当前区域性为 EN-US。It serializes a date and time on a system that observes U.S. Pacific time and whose current culture is en-US. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/serialize1.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/serialize1.vb#17)] 它反序列化布鲁塞尔，哥本哈根，马德里，巴黎时区中的系统上的数据和当前区域性为 fr-fr。It deserializes the data on a system in the Brussels, Copenhagen, Madrid and Paris time zone and whose current culture is fr-FR. 还原后的日期是九个小时后于原始日期，这反映了比 utc 晚八个小时内为早于 utc 时间一小时的时区调整。The restored date is nine hours later than the original date, which reflects the time zone adjustment from eight hours behind UTC to one hour ahead of UTC. 原始日期和还原后的日期表示同一时刻。Both the original date and the restored date represent the same moment in time. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/serialize2.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/serialize2.vb#18)] ## Examples 下面的示例使用反射获取的属性英语 （美国） 区域性的对象。The following example uses reflection to get the properties of the object for the English (United States) culture. 它显示包含自定义格式字符串的这些属性的值，并使用这些字符串来显示格式化的日期。It displays the value of those properties that contain custom format strings and uses those strings to display formatted dates. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/cs/format1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Class#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.class/vb/format1.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数创建表示固定区域性的日期和时间信息的对象。This constructor creates a object that represents the date and time information of the invariant culture. 若要创建对象针对特定区域性，创建区域性的对象，并检索返回的对象及其属性。To create a object for a specific culture, create a object for that culture and retrieve the object returned by its property. 属性可以修改此构造函数创建的对象。The properties of the object created by this constructor can be modified. 但是，不能修改属性，因为固定区域性支持本地化的版本的公历。However, you cannot modify the property, because the invariant culture supports only a localized version of the Gregorian calendar. 若要创建对象，它使用特定的日历，必须实例化对象，该对象支持的日历，并将分配到日历的属性返回对象属性.To create a object that uses a specific calendar, you must instantiate a object that supports that calendar and assign the calendar to the property of the object returned by the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在某些语言中，属于某个日期的月份名称出现在所有格。In some languages, a month name that is part of a date appears in the genitive case. 例如，RU-RU 或俄语 （俄罗斯） 区域性的日期组成的日编号和所有格月份名称，如 1 Января （1 年 1 月）。For example, a date in the ru-RU or Russian (Russia) culture consists of the day number and the genitive month name, such as 1 Января (1 January). 对于这些区域性，如果自定义格式字符串包含"MMM"格式说明符或方法包含的适当成员代替结果字符串中的"MMM"数组。For these cultures, if a custom format string includes the "MMM" format specifier, the or method includes the appropriate member of the array in place of the "MMM" in the result string. 在设置操作中，该数组必须是 13 个元素的一维因为对象提供有 13 个月的日历。In a set operation, the array must be one-dimensional with exactly 13 elements, because objects accommodate calendars that have 13 months. 对于具有 12 个月的日历，第 13 个元素应为。For calendars that have 12 months, the thirteenth element should be . 第一个元素 （索引零开始的元素） 表示定义的一年的第一个月属性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first month of the year defined by the property. 如果您设置属性，则还必须设置属性。If you set the property, you must also set the property. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个读/写对象，表示英语 （美国） 区域性，并将分配缩写所有格月份名称传递给其和属性。The following example creates a read/write object that represents the English (United States) culture and assigns abbreviated genitive month names to its and properties. 然后，它显示日期的区域性的支持的日历中包括的每月缩写的月份名称的字符串表示的形式。It then displays the string representation of dates that include the abbreviated month name of each month in the culture's supported calendar. span.span: An array that contains the standard patterns in which date and time values can be formatted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回一个包含对应于标准格式字符串的所有自定义格式字符串的数组。This method returns an array that contains all custom format strings that correspond to standard format strings. 请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)有关标准格式字符串的列表。See [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) for a list of the standard format strings. 您可以使用自定义格式字符串中返回的数组在格式设置操作的方法。You can use the custom format strings in the array returned by the method in formatting operations. 但是，如果这样做，日期和时间值的字符串表示形式返回，格式设置操作不能始终首先分析已成功通过`Parse`和`TryParse`方法。However, if you do, the string representation of a date and time value returned in that formatting operation cannot always be parsed successfully by the `Parse` and `TryParse` methods. 因此，不能假定返回自定义格式字符串方法可用于往返日期和时间值。Therefore, you cannot assume that the custom format strings returned by the method can be used to round-trip date and time values. 以下示例阐释了此问题。The following example illustrates this problem. 它检索包含意大利 （意大利语） 区域性的格式设置信息的对象。It retrieves a object that contains formatting information for the Italy (Italian) culture. 它返回的数组中传递的每个自定义格式字符串方法方法来创建日期和时间的字符串表示形式。It passes each custom format string in the array returned by the method to the method to create the string representation of a date and time. 此示例然后尝试通过调用分析此值方法。This example then attempts to parse this value by calling the method. 如示例输出所示，某些自定义格式字符串不会生成一个日期和时间值的成功往返。As the output from the example shows, some of the custom format strings do not produce a date and time value that successfully round-trips. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/cs/getalldatetimepatternsex1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/vb/getalldatetimepatternsex1.vb#1)] 若要分析的日期和时间，可以以多种预定义的自定义格式的字符串表示形式，请调用以下方法之一：To parse the string representation of a date and time that can be expressed in a number of predefined custom formats, call one of the following methods: - - - - 返回的数组中的自定义格式字符串方法取决于为其当前区域性的日历对象提供格式设置信息。The custom format strings in the array returned by the method depends on the current calendar of the culture for which the object supplies formatting information. 如果更改日历，此方法返回的数组也会更改。If the calendar changes, the array returned by this method also changes. ## Examples 以下示例显示日期和时间格式字符串，用于固定区域性，以及时，将生成格式字符串用于设置特定日期的格式的结果字符串。The following example displays the date and time format strings for the invariant culture, as well as the result string that is produced when that format string is used to format a particular date. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/cs/getalldatetimepatternsinv.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/vb/getalldatetimepatternsinv.vb#3)] 该示例实例化对象，通过调用表示固定区域性构造函数。The example instantiates a object that represents the invariant culture by calling the constructor. 它还可以检索，表示从固定区域性属性。It could also retrieve a that represents the invariant culture from the property.

[!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/cs/getalldatetimepatternsex2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.GetAllDateTimePatterns#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.getalldatetimepatterns/vb/getalldatetimepatternsex2.vb#2)] 若要分析的日期和时间，可以以多种预定义的自定义格式的字符串表示形式，请调用以下方法之一：To parse the string representation of a date and time that can be expressed in a number of predefined custom formats, call one of the following methods: - - - - 返回的数组中的自定义格式字符串方法取决于为其当前区域性的日历对象提供格式设置信息。The custom format strings in the array returned by the method depends on the current calendar of the culture for which the object supplies formatting information. 如果更改日历，此方法返回的数组也会更改。If the calendar changes, the array returned by this method also changes. ## Examples 下面的示例显示当前日历的日期和时间模式。The following example displays the date and time patterns for the current calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性不会更改，而不考虑当前区域性。This property does not change, regardless of the current culture. 因此，固定区域性的对象可用于生成分析和格式设置是多文化的数据操作的操作中的一致、 独立于区域性的结果。Because of this, the invariant culture's object can be used to produce consistent, culture-independent results in parsing and formatting operations on data that is multi-cultural. 例如，如果从多个区域性的日期和时间数据将保留以字符串形式，它可设置的格式使用固定区域性的对象，并已保存。For example, if date and time data from multiple cultures is to be persisted in string form, it can be formatted by using the object of the invariant culture and saved. 然后可以通过使用固定区域性分析对象。It can then be parsed by using the invariant culture's object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义通过调用返回的日期字符串的区域性特定格式和方法，并由复合格式字符串提供的"T"标准格式字符串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "T" standard format string. 我们建议将时间分隔符设置而不是使用时间分隔符占位符精确的字符串的长时间模式。We recommend that you set the time separator in the long time pattern to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要获取模式 h mm ss，设置为"h-mm-ss"的长日期模式。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the long date pattern to "h-mm-ss". ## Examples 下面的示例显示的值某些区域性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongTimePattern/CPP/dtfi_longtimepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongTimePattern/CS/dtfi_longtimepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.LongTimePattern/VB/dtfi_longtimepattern.vb#1)]

summary.span: 为月和日值获取或设置自定义格式字符串。

span.span: Gets or sets the custom format string for a month and day value.

value.span: 可排序的月份和日期值的自定义格式字符串。

span.span: The custom format string for a month and day value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义通过调用返回的日期字符串的区域性特定格式和方法，并通过复合格式字符串提供的"m"和"M"标准格式字符串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "m" and "M" standard format strings. 如果此属性受影响的值属性更改。This property is affected if the value of the property changes. 我们建议在精确的字符串而不是使用日期分隔符占位符的月份和日期模式中设置的日期分隔符。We recommend that you set the date separator in the month and day pattern to an exact string instead of using the date separator placeholder. 例如，若要获取的模式-MM-DD，设置为"月-日"的月份和日期模式。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD, set the month and day pattern to "MM-DD". ## Examples 下面的示例显示的值某些区域性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern/CPP/dtfi_monthdaypattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern/CS/dtfi_monthdaypattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.MonthDayPattern/VB/dtfi_monthdaypattern.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在某些语言中，属于某个日期的月份名称出现在所有格。In some languages, a month name that is part of a date appears in the genitive case. 例如，俄语 （俄罗斯） 或"RU-RU"中的日期，区域性由的日编号和所有格月份名称，如 1 Января 组成。For example, a date in the Russian (Russia) or "ru-RU", culture consists of the day number and the genitive month name, such as 1 Января. 时设置此属性，该数组必须是一维，并且必须具有 13 个元素。When this property is set, the array must be one-dimensional and must have exactly 13 elements. 对象提供具有 13 个月的日历。 objects accommodate calendars with 13 months. 第一个元素 （索引零开始的元素） 表示定义的一年的第一个月属性。如果您设置属性，则还必须设置属性。The first element (the element at index zero) represents the first month of the year defined by the property.If you set the property, you must also set the property. ## Examples 下面的示例演示几个方法和指定日期和时间格式模式、 本地日历名称和完整和缩写的月份和日期名称的属性。The following example demonstrates several methods and properties that specify date and time format patterns, native calendar name, and full and abbreviated month and day names. summary.span: 获取或设置表示处于"下午"（中午后）的各小时的字符串指示项。

span.span: The default for is "PM".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性用于所有时间自 12:00:00 （中午） 到 23:59:59.999。The property is used for all times from 12:00:00 (noon) to 23:59:59.999. 如果自定义模式包括格式模式"tt"且时间是在中午之后,显示的值代替在格式模式中的"tt"。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern "tt" and the time is after noon, displays the value of in place of the "tt" in the format pattern. 如果自定义模式中包括的格式模式"t"的第一个字符仅显示。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern "t", only the first character of is displayed. 它是需要维护 AM 与 PM 之间差异的语言，你的应用程序应使用"tt"。Your application should use "tt" for languages for which it is necessary to maintain the distinction between AM and PM. 以日语为例，其 AM 和 PM 指示符的差异点为第二个字符，而非第一个字符。An example is Japanese, for which the AM and PM designators differ in the second character instead of the first character. 对于不使用 PM 指示符的区域性，此属性返回空字符串。For cultures that do not use a PM designator, this property returns an empty string.

summary.span: 获取自定义的格式字符串，该字符串用于基于 Internet 工程任务组 (IETF) 征求意见文档 (RFC) 1123 规范的时间值。

span.span: Gets the custom format string for a time value that is based on the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) Request for Comments (RFC) 1123 specification.

value.span: 基于 IETF RFC 1123 规范的时间值的自定义格式字符串。

span.span: The custom format string for a time value that is based on the IETF RFC 1123 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义通过调用返回的日期字符串的区域性特定格式和方法，并通过复合格式字符串提供的"r"和"R"标准格式字符串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "r" and "R" standard format strings. RFC1123 模式反映已定义的标准，并且该属性是只读的。The RFC1123 pattern reflects a defined standard, and the property is read-only. 因此，它始终是相同的而不考虑的区域性。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 定义格式字符串为“ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT'”。The custom format string is "ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT'". ## Examples 以下示例显示几个区域性 RFC1123Pattern 的值。The following example displays the value of RFC1123Pattern for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern/CPP/dtfi_rfc1123pattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern/CS/dtfi_rfc1123pattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.RFC1123Pattern/VB/dtfi_rfc1123pattern.vb#1)]

param.name: format

summary.span: 设置对应于指定的标准格式字符串的自定义日期和时间格式字符串。

span.span: Sets the custom date and time format strings that correspond to a specified standard format string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法为特定的标准日期和时间格式字符串定义对应的自定义格式字符串。The method defines the custom format strings that correspond to a particular standard date and time format string. 如果调用日期和时间格式设置方法包括标准日期和时间格式字符串指定`format`，该方法使用的第一个元素`patterns`要定义生成的字符串的格式数组。If a call to a date and time formatting method includes the standard date and time format string specified by `format`, the method uses the first element in the `patterns` array to define the format of the resulting string. > [!WARNING] > `Parse`并`TryParse`方法不会完全迭代中的所有字符串`patterns`时分析的日期和时间的字符串表示形式。The `Parse` and `TryParse` methods do not fully iterate all strings in `patterns` when parsing the string representation of a date and time. 如果您需要在分析操作中具有特定格式的日期和时间字符串，应传递到的有效格式的数组， ， ，或方法。If you require a date and time string to have particular formats in a parsing operation, you should pass the array of valid formats to the , , , or method. 您可以定义自定义格式字符串对应于"d"、"D"、"t"、"T"和"y"或"Y"标准日期和时间格式字符串。You can define custom format strings that correspond to the "d", "D", "t", "T", and "y" or "Y" standard date and time format strings. 如果的值`format`是任何其他标准格式字符串方法会抛出。If the value of `format` is any other standard format string, the method throws an . 如果你的自定义日期和时间格式字符串中包含的日期分隔符，应显式指定的日期分隔符，而不是依靠替换特定的日期分隔符为"/"自定义格式说明符分析或格式设置方法。If your custom date and time format strings include date separators, you should explicitly specify a date separator instead of relying on the parsing or formatting method that replaces the "/" custom format specifier with a particular date separator. 例如，若要获取模式月-日-年，使用模式"月-日-年"。For example, to obtain the pattern MM-DD-yyyy, use the pattern "MM-DD-yyyy". ## Examples 下面的示例实例化对象表示"EN-US"（英语-美国） 区域性，并使用它来分析日期和时间字符串使用"Y"标准格式字符串的数组。The following example instantiates a object that represents the "en-US" (English - United States) culture and uses it to parse an array of date and time strings using the "Y" standard format string. 然后，它使用方法以将新的自定义格式字符串与"Y"标准格式字符串，然后尝试分析的日期和时间的字符串数组相关联。It then uses the method to associate a new custom format string with the "Y" standard format string, and then attempts to parse the array of date and time strings. 示例输出演示，在分析和格式设置操作中使用新的自定义格式字符串。Output from the example demonstrates that the new custom format string is used in both the parsing and formatting operations. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.setalldatetimepatterns/cs/setalldatetimepatterns.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.SetAllDateTimePatterns#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.setalldatetimepatterns/vb/setalldatetimepatterns.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义通过调用返回的日期字符串的区域性特定格式和方法，并由复合格式字符串提供的"t"标准格式字符串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "t" standard format string. 我们建议将时间分隔符设置而不是使用时间分隔符占位符精确的字符串的短时间模式。We recommend that you set the time separator in the short time pattern to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要获取模式 h mm ss，设置为"h-mm-ss"的短时间模式。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the short time pattern to "h-mm-ss". ## Examples 下面的示例显示的值某些区域性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. value.span: 可排序的日期和时间值的自定义格式字符串。

span.span: The custom format string for a sortable date and time value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义通过调用返回的日期字符串的区域性特定格式和方法，并通过复合格式字符串提供"s"标准格式字符串。The property defines the culture-specific format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "s" standard format string. 返回的格式字符串属性会反映出定义的标准 (ISO 8601)，并且属性是只读的。The format string returned by the property reflects a defined standard (ISO 8601), and the property is read-only. 因此，它始终是相同的而不考虑的区域性。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自定义格式字符串为“yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss”。The custom format string is "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss". ## Examples 下面的示例显示的值某些区域性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. summary.span: 获取或设置分隔时间中各组成部分（即小时、分钟和秒钟）的字符串。

span.span: Gets or sets the string that separates the components of time, that is, the hour, minutes, and seconds.

value.span: 分隔时间中各组成部分的字符串。

span.span: The string that separates the components of time.

value.span: 的默认值为“:”。

span.span: The default for is ":".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果自定义模式中包括的格式模式":"，显示的值来代替":"格式模式中。If the custom pattern includes the format pattern ":", displays the value of in place of the ":" in the format pattern. 时间分隔符派生自属性。The time separator is derived from the property. 我们建议您以短设置时间分隔符或长时间为确切字符串而不是使用时间分隔符占位符模式。We recommend that you set the time separator in short or long time patterns to an exact string instead of using the time separator placeholder. 例如，若要获取模式 h mm ss，设置该模式与"h-mm-ss"。For example, to obtain the pattern h-mm-ss, set the pattern to "h-mm-ss". 这种做法还可以设置模式，如"h'h 'mm' ss '"(3 个 h 36 m 分 12 秒)，包括多个类型的分隔符。This practice also enables you to set patterns such as "h'h 'mm'm 'ss's'" (3h 36m 12s) that include multiple types of separators. 属性定义来代替时间分隔符的字符串 (":"自定义日期和时间格式说明符) 中的结果字符串中的格式设置操作。The property defines the string that replaces the time separator (":" custom date and time format specifier) in a result string in a formatting operation. 它还在分析操作中定义的时间分隔符字符串。It also defines the time separator string in a parsing operation. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化对象对于 EN-US 区域性中，更改到其日期分隔符"。"，并通过使用"t"、"T"、"F"、"f"、"G"和"g"标准格式字符串来显示日期。The following example instantiates a object for the en-US culture, changes its date separator to ".", and displays a date by using the "t", "T", "F", "f", "G", and "g" standard format strings. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.timeseparator/cs/timeseparatorex.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.TimeSeparator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.datetimeformatinfo.timeseparator/vb/timeseparatorex.vb#1)]

summary.span: 获取 ISO 8601 定义的通用的可排序日期和时间字符串的自定义格式字符串。

span.span: Gets the custom format string for a universal, sortable date and time string, as defined by ISO 8601.

value.span: 通用的可排序的日期和时间字符串的自定义格式字符串。

span.span: The custom format string for a universal, sortable date and time string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义的由调用返回的日期字符串格式和方法，并通过复合格式字符串提供"u"标准格式字符串。The property defines the format of date strings that are returned by calls to the and methods and by composite format strings that are supplied the "u" standard format string. 它可以用于显示日期和时间与结束时的通用时间指示符"Z"可排序顺序。It can be used to display dates and times in a sortable order with the universal time designator "Z" at the end. 格式为可排序，因为它使用前导零的年、 月、 日、 小时、 分钟和秒。The format is sortable because it uses leading zeros for year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. 自定义格式字符串 ("yyyy '-' MM'-' dd HH': 'mm': 'ss'Z'") 区域性或格式提供程序无论是相同的。The custom format string ("yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'") is the same regardless of culture or format provider. 返回的格式字符串属性会反映出定义的标准，并且属性是只读的。The format string returned by the property reflects a defined standard, and the property is read-only. 因此，它始终是相同的而不考虑的区域性。Therefore, it is always the same, regardless of the culture. 自定义格式字符串为“yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'”。The custom format string is "yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z'". ## Examples 下面的示例显示的值某些区域性。The following example displays the value of for a few cultures. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/CPP/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/CS/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.UniversalSortableDateTimePattern/VB/dtfi_universalsortabledatetimepattern.vb#1)]
